pycfd package

Submodules

pycfd.pymesh module

pycfd.pymesh.check_empty_input(lines_from_file, error_message)[source]

Check if the lines read from a file are empty (or contain only whitespaces) and return the EOFError exception if that occurs

Parameters

  • lines_from_file (list) – Text lines read from a file (with .readlines() usually)

  • error_message (string) – Errore message to be associate with the EOFError exception

Raises

EOFError – In a way, if the file is empty or contains only whitespaces it is true that the file reader has reached EOF without encountering “anything useful” for the solver/mesher

Returns

Return type

None.

pycfd.pymesh.convert_raw_mesh(raw_mesh_file, mesh_file)[source]

Convert raw coordinates into mesh format

Parameters

  • raw_mesh_file (string) – Name of the file containing raw coordinates

  • mesh_file (string) – Name of the converted mesh file

Returns

Return type

None.

pycfd.pymesh.mesher(input_file, mesh_file, discr_method='cellcenter')[source]

Create a 1D mesh and save it to file

Parameters

  • input_file (string) – Name of the input file required to generate the mesh

  • mesh_file (string) – Mesh filename

  • discr_method (string) –

    Type of discretisation used:

    • 'cellcenter' : cell-center

    • 'cellvertex': cell-vertex (NOT implemented)

Returns

Return type

None.

pycfd.pymesh.print_mesh(mesh, mesh_file)[source]

Print the mesh saving it in a plain text file

Parameters

  • mesh (array) – Mesh coordinates

  • mesh_file (string) – Name of the file where to save the mesh

Returns

Return type

None.

Returns

geometry – Parameters describing the geometry contained in the input file

Parameters
